tagDescription: Canada & the U.S. 116. Amendment Fresh Water Fisheries Treaty. . .Terms of Reference Newfoundland. . .Proposed Waterways Commission. . .Mr. Root's opinion
482. Interview with Goldwin Smith - his indignation at action of Toronto Legislative in closing doors of Justice against public interest. . .re Hydro Electric Commission

455. Thinks time opportune for sending reply to H.M.G. re questions for discussion at approaching Imperial Conference: Question of self-governing Dominions being under roof of their own & having a Minister of their own. Probable that conference will consider this. . .Question of financial boycott of nation rushing into war without previously submitting cause to Hague Tribunal.
513. Enclosing paraphrases of cyphers from Washington
436. re Philip Kerr - Manitoba & school question - R.C. & Protestants
417. Act creating Dept. of External Affairs passed unamended. re substitution of word care for conduct
Canada & the U.S. 57. re his visiting Canada. . .
Canada & the U.S. 145. General Arbitration Treaty - Sir W.L. says there is no provision binding on contracting parties to accept the award

Miscellaneous Correspondence 1. Monseigneur Sbarretti...Notes of interview - R.C. advantages under British rule - Old France & French Canada (religious feeling) - French Consul General - Immigration of Sisters & Nuns to Canada - Keeping apart of French & English Catholics.
538. Enclosing Washington telegram asking for name of Canadian Reptves. at Fisheries Conference
Canada & the U.S. 21. re answer to R's letter
Canada & the U.S. 118. General Arbitration Treaty. . .Tribunal of Judges. . .proviso that awards shall not be binding upon the States - quite absurd
564. Mr. Bryce's concession of the reasonableness of Canada's attitude - Sir C.F.' indiscretion in committing Canada. . .Sir W.L. will ask him for full report on what took place
Canada & the U.S. 7. Sending photo etc. - re his wish to 'clean the slate' etc.
Canada & the U.S. 157. F. Gerring case - do not see how it is possible to depart from undertaking that this case would be included in claims for arbitration. Terms of Reference
405. re I.S.O. for Superintendent N.W.M.P.
560. Omission of report on Military Defence in Volume of Imp. Conference
401. Debate on Naval position. . .State of coal sheds at Halifax. . .Change of Minister in Marine Dept.
Correspondence with Mr. Borden 5. Suggesting Civil Service Commission. . .Canadian Naval Policy & Plebiscite
532. Honours: suggested Knighthood for Judge Osler
Canada & the U.S. 49. Mr. Root's speech - Fisheries debate - 'modus vivendi' - Root views - he now understands Canadian position
Canada & the U.S. 147. N. Channel question disposed of - Wreckage & Dalvage Treaty - suggested omission of Atlantic coast. . .Pecuniary claims. . .Quebec celebrations. .
552. Fisheries Award. . .Will not be bound by a mere interpretation of the Treaty. . .re Dillon. . .U.S. have tried every inducement to have him released. . .Sir W.L. will not give his permission
Miscellaneous Correspondence 2. Clarke's Milk FarmNotes re visit - Reduction of infant mortality
Canada & the U.S. 23. Canadian Govts reply to Mr. Root's Memo. On outstanding questions
Canada & the U.S. 59. re his visiting Canada. . .
Canada & the U.S. 90. re constitutionality of O.-in-C. re Newfoundland fisheries - Canada & U.S. urging haste with treaties - Newfoundland fisheries & terms of reference
558. Success of Canadian negotiations under the Mr. Bryce's guidance
Canada & the U.S. 47. re date of his visit to Ottawa
Canada & the U.S. 121. Delimitation of Boundaries Treaty - Mr. Root's anxiety to get it through Senate before March....Newfoundland Draft Terms of Reference
Canada & the U.S. 107. Fresh water fisheries treaty - apprehension of trouble in Lake Champlain unless matter is sett1ed - re North Channel - Re his visit
Canada & the U.S. 168. Mr. Brodeur asks for information as to U.S. Commissioner on Fisheries Treaty, in order to know what sort of man to appoint from Canada.
467. re official communications from Washington
490. Lord Crewe's suggestion re separation of Crown Colonies & Self-Governing Dominions administration in London - Mr. Fielding's objection

Canada & the U.S. 119. Delimitation of Boundaries Treaty. . .Amendments accepted by Mr. Root. . .Mr. Gibbons & International Waters Treaty. . .Bond's Draft Terms of Reference....Japanese arrangement re restricting of immigration. . .should U.S. be informed privately.
452. Mr. Bryce suggests expediency of withholding from U.S. information that Canada will enter conference until they have committed themselves on subject of compensation
480. Do not understand what cable means - Already settled that Sir H. Finlay should appear at Hague
427. Forwarding letter from Mr. Bryce re Treaty
433. re interview with sealers in B.C. urgency of settling Pelagic Sealing question, as herd rapidly decreasing. Views of Boscowitz & his colleagues

Canada & the U.S. 126. Quebec Tercentenary - Will consult Jusserand as to French appeal. . .Hanotaux very anti-British - President's strange action re Japan. . .important that full & careful memorandum be drawn up by Mr. King on Japanese Question, including all that President & Mr. Root said to him - Japan promised to restrict immigration to U.S.
Miscellaneous Correspondence 38. re his Montreal hospitality - Concert Hall - The C.P.R. & contract for Orient mails - Fast Oriental Service
Canada & the U.S. 154. American Fleet going to Vancouver. . .danger of anti-Japanese demonstration
491. re amended draft of Speech on Prorogation
Miscellaneous Correspondence 28. Winnipeg Cadets etc.
Miscellaneous Correspondence 16. Waterways Commission - defining scope of - re proposed visit to West Point
Canada & the U.S. 158. Memorandum on Pelagic Sealing. . .Sir W.L. wants 10 years term
Canada & the U.S. 81. re Bishop of London's visit - Lord Losebarn
545. Amended Table of Precedence

509. Seditious picture. . .Col. Sherwood right person to take matter in hand. . . Pelagic Sealing: no reason to think information leaked at Ottawa. Pelagic Treaty:Busy with delegations, but with endeavour to have satisfactory settlement by Sat. (4th)
406. Royal Commission on West Indies Trade - Mr. Fielding & another to represent Canada

Canada & the U.S. 146. Delimitation Boundaries Treaty. .& Fresh Water Fisheries Treaty submitted to Canada - International Waters - General Arbitration Treaty - U.S. accept amendment of H.M. Govt. . .Hague Convention provides that decision be abided by. . .Pecuniary claims - Newfoundland Arbitration - Impossible for Senate to accept Root's terms of Reference without waiting for Canada's & Nfld's. This is also view of F.O.
Canada & the U.S. 72. re Lady Evelyn's visit - Mr. A. Stone Mather's visit to India

465. Boundary Waters Treaty - Mr. Bryce's talk with U.S. Head of Reclamatory Service, leads him to believe that position is satisfactory with regard to Canada. Conservation Commission's objections to American proposals re Power Development at Long Sault Rapids force upon are the advantages to Canada resulting from B.W.T.
486. re an amending Act to enable transfer of External Affairs Dept. to any Minister nominated by the G.G. in Council

Miscellaneous Correspondence 21. Toronto speech - Nossé & Japan - re disallowance of anti-Japanese Bills - Trans-Pacific wheat trade - rice eating v. wheat eating - Cascapedia would be irresistible - French Consul & Nelson Centenary

Miscellaneous Correspondence 17. Toronto Globe & the forces which are directing it?? - It's Bourassa arguments. . Toronto News & Mr. Flavelle - Mr. Ross & his proposed visit to England - Whitney - Hanna - B.E. Walker - Mackenzie - Flavelle & contributions to the fleet - Willison - Autonomy Bill - H.E. speech (Toronto) & English press comments - Preference & disinclination of Govt. to move resolution in Canada H. of C. - denotes either boyhood or want of manhood.

Canada & the U.S. 171. re desire of American Fleet to visit B.C. Hope Sir W.L. will create a Dept. of External Affairs. No hope of getting Nfld. Arbitration agreement through. Will discuss matters with Lord Crewe & Sir E. Grey in London

Canada & the U.S. 159. Pecuniary Claims Delay. . .Behring Sea. . .Commissioners for St. John's River question - Canadian suggestions improvement on Nfld. Draft Terms of Reference - Vice President Fairbanks to represent U.S. at Quebec.
469. Expressing for Minutes on B.W.T. & Behring Sea
478. re Provincial Conference in Ottawa
Canada & the U.S. 33. re Outstanding questions - Root's visit cypher cable
Miscellaneous Correspondence 37. re Canadian attaché at Washington - Fast Service to the Orient
Miscellaneous Correspondence 9. Reception in Canada - Drawing Room - expense of Governor-General ship
Canada & the U.S. 1. Visit to Washington - re 'cleaning the slate'
Canada & the U.S. 177. Mr. Bastedo & Inland Fisheries . . .International Waters. . .Confidential Despatch to C.O. telling what has been accomplished. F. Ger-ring case. . .Quebec & French attitude
Canada & the U.S. 10. Carnegie indignant that Lodge & 72 fishermen should interfere with cleaning the slate !
439. Mr. Pedley's removal from Eastern Block to make room for Mr. Pope

Miscellaneous Correspondence 27. Presentation to H.M. Govt. Dominion - reduction of Postal rates printed matter - Establishment of a Transatlantic Service to give Canada benefit of geographical position - W. Churchill's book
421. Pelagic Sealing. . .U.S. press for official reply
Canada & the U.S. 68. Not much chance of free fish
Canada & the U.S. 35. Enclosing copy of above letter - 'Cleaning the Slate - Pennsylvania University
Canada & the U.S. 3. Memo on Pelagic Sealing & N.A. Fisheries
Canada & the U.S. 34. His visit to Ottawa - Has received no reply to his Memo. re cleaning the slate - New York elections etc.
451. Pelagic Sealing. . .doubts expediency of asking U.S. to assess annual value of 20% offered, that amount depending on catch & price of skins etc. etc.
550. Enclosing memo. on Hague Tribunal recommendations - J.H. Hammond comes to Ottawa with a special message re Dillon imprisoned at Kingston for political reasons

Canada & the U.S. 170. Pelagic Sealing. .Freshwater Fisheries - U.S. Govt. appointing expert. North Atlantic Fisheries - Draft agreement not yet arrived from C.O. no chance of settling matter before adjournment. Root wants Court of Five - C.O. prefer 3  Pecuniary Claims

Canada & the U.S. 128. Mr. Gibbons & Mr. Root on International Waters Question. . .Milk River. . .Mr. Root presses for answer to his letter & Draft Treaty: says it is impossible that it can wait for General Waterways Treaty - seems no reason why with a little concession on both sides, we should not get all three Treaties settled before April. . .New President will make things harder. .
Canada & the U.S. 28. War vessels on the great Lakes  Enclosing No. - Re 1854-66 Reciprocity
468. Incomplete memoranda from State Dept. at Washington - Impossible to do anything till further information received
483. Request from Mr. Bryce for Canadian jurists to act as arbitrator in a dispute between Mexico & U.S.
544. Invitation to members of Parliament to attend Coronation. . .Mr. Difton's opposition to Reciprocity
Canada & the U.S. 30. Re U.S. Elections - inviting him to stay here - re cleaning the slate

Canada & the U.S. 113. Re his visit - Waterways Commission - Sir W.L. sticks to Treaty & will not budge an inch from it. He is hopeless as to future negotiations with the U.S. if Senate will not pass a joint & unanimous recommendation, backed up by U.S. Executive. Re Georgian Bay & North Channel
454. St. Mary River Reservoir. . .confidential Despatch from Mr. Bryce
Canada & the U.S. 55. Mr. Root's visit - cleaning the slate - Japs & California
Miscellaneous Correspondence 40. Accepting invitation to stay at White House - Franklin picture

Canada & the U.S. 71. re Sir R. Cartwright's suggestion of a Permanent International Court for G.B. and U.S. 'Alert' case
Canada & the U.S. 39. Letter saying sorry he is leaving Washington etc. etc. - Root's visit
437. re Philip Kerr - Location of External Affairs Office

Miscellaneous Correspondence 22. also Lady Minto - Butter speech - political conditions at home

Canada & the U.S. 153. H.E. goes to Bermuda. . .Nfld. Terms of Reference sent to C.O. & to Washington, but not to Ottawa. Nfld. ignores Canada. . .Canada's Terms of Reference cannot be prepared until she has seen Nfld's.
521. re absence in Montreal

562. Also a memo. On Mr. Bryce's last letter. . .Attempt to hoed up Arbitration Treaty most unworthy
526. re Coronation Invitation. . .New Zealand, Australia & S. Africa all accept. . .Canada remains uncertain

473. Enclosing Mr. Bryce's letter re unfair imputations of N.Y. Herald

495. re publication in press of Secretary of State's supposed action in correcting proclamation of King's title made at home

Canada & the U.S. 106. Pending draft treaties - International Waterways - no chance of its going through Senate in its present form - Urging haste re treaties

Canada & the U.S. 139. Not yet heard from Ontario Govt. re North Channel. . .Mr. King's visit to Washington & interviews with Messrs. Root & Bacon: also President - previous impressions confirmed. . .Mr. Root takes serious view - everything depends on Japan taking sane view - U.S. will not stand trifling - Hindus in Vancouver 200 deported on arrival - Hansard report of speeches on Japanese question
432. American poaching off coast of B.C. under eyes of Canadian survey vessels
527. Bourassa victory at Athabaska - H.E. hopes this may be a blessing in disguise. . .& the cause of a campaign of enlightenment in the P. of Quebec

Canada & the U.S. 103. Pennsylvania Fisheries Conference - International Waterways Commission Treaty & the Senate  Senate unlikely to give so much power to a Commission contested claims - F.S. Gerring case - Pelagic Sealing - U.S. want a reply re the National equivalent Sir W.L. spoke about - Root getting more uneasy about delays.

Canada & the U.S. 133. Sir W.L.'s attitude on Milk River question - All questions arising out of contiguous waters should be under same authority i.e. Waterways Commission, not disposed to give up this point, even if Treaty delayed.
462. Regret impossible Mr. Pugsley go to Washington . . . Mr. Bryce asks for decision re Behring Sea compensation
446. re French Treaty & Tariff - Favour for Favour - Before Canada approached France she was refused concessions by U.S.
402 re Sifton as Minister of Marine
Miscellaneous Correspondence 35. re Guelph Experimental Farm & - Brooke Hunt's report!
Canada & the U.S. 54. Root's visit - Canadian sentiment  Gloucester fleet etc.

570. Treasury Board Reports
438. Location of External Affairs Office
415. Special Conference in London, on Defence

493. Passamaquoddy Bay. . .Council willing to accept Treaty as now drafted

442. re Speech from Throne & reference to Boundary Waters Treaty
496. Behring Sea: H.E. informs Mr. Bryce of Sir W.L.'s objections, & that if U.S. agree to suspension of ten years instead of cessation there would be little difficulty in getting minor requirements

Canada & the U.S. 95. Hague reference - does not agree with Sir W.L. about getting U.S. to move first - Thinks Home Govt. should submit views - then obtain Nfld. & Canadian views before going to U.S.
506. U.S. Govt. anxious to keep Pelagic Sealing arrangements secret, as Japan & Russia may apply for compensation

Boundaries Treaty - Mr. Bacon & diversion of Rainy River Waters - Canada's reply to Milk River Treaty - Little hope of such matters being given to Waterways Commission for settlement - Doubtful if Senate will divest itself of right to deal with matters of international agreement. . .re the King's possible visit to Washington
